required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Manual Ventilation Efficacy With MVG Device
clinical_study.official_title: Improvement of Manual Ventilation Efficacy With Ventilation Grip Device: A Manikin Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to investigate the efficacy of the newly designed ventilation grip device (MVG device).

primary_outcome.description: As measured using the ventilator machine in milliliters

secondary_outcome.measure: Hand fatigue as measured by hand grip strength
secondary_outcome.description: Hand Grip strength as measured by the grip device in kilograms

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue as measured by NASA-TLX questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: NASA Task Load Index (TLX) questionnaire has a total overall workload score ranging from 0 and 126 with the higher score indicating greater demand.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue as measured by SOFI questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Swedish Occupational Fatigue Inventory (SOFI) questionnaire has a total score ranging from 0 to 120 with the higher score indicating greater fatigue

arm_group.arm_group_label: Expert participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE
arm_group.description: Expert participants (Anesthesiology residents and attendings with at least 2 or more years of clinical experience) randomized to perform the ventilation on a manikin using the Manual ventilation grip device (MVG) first followed by the standard 2VE technique alone.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Expert participants randomized to 2VE followed by MVG
arm_group.description: Expert participants (Anesthesiology residents and attendings with at least 2 or more years of clinical experience) randomized to perform the ventilation on a manikin using the standard technique (2VE) alone first followed by Manual ventilation grip device (MVG).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Novice participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE
arm_group.description: Novice participants (Current medical students or residents with no prior experience in hand mask ventilation techniques) first followed by the standard technique (2VE) alone

arm_group.arm_group_label: Novice participants randomized to 2VE followed by MVG
arm_group.description: Novice participants (Current medical students or residents with no prior experience in hand mask ventilation techniques) randomized to perform the ventilation on a manikin using the standard technique (2VE) alone first followed by Manual ventilation grip device (MVG)

intervention.description: Manual Ventilation Grip Device is an add-on device placed on a standard valve mask to assist ventilation.
intervention.arm_group_label: Expert participants randomized to 2VE followed by MVG
Expert participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE
Novice participants randomized to 2VE followed by MVG
Novice participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE
Expert participants randomized to 2VE followed by MVG
Expert participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE

Novice participants randomized to MVG followed by 2VE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Current medical students, Post Graduate Year 1 (PGY1) residents or residents from other specialties with no prior experience in hand mask ventilation techniques or anesthesiology residents and attendings with at least 2 or more years of clinical experience
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Refusal to participate in the study.
2. Medical students with prior experience in hand mask ventilation techniques (i.e. experiences in previous careers such as nursing or Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) professions)
3. Any physical inability to adequately perform ventilation
